widget.label: Turn the OAuth2 feature ON or OFF
widget.tooltip: Check this box to enable the OAuth2 feature. When OAuth2 is enabled applications that know of various API supported by your website can log in and manage your website remotely.
Enter the email address of the user who will be logged in for this application to work with private data.
widget.help: When the OAuth2 tool logs an application in, it has to make use of a user. This is done by assigning the session identifier to the email address specified here. Note that the application will have all the rights that this user has.

widget.tooltip: The OAuth2 plugin generates a connection identifier. This field shows you that identifier.
The OAuth2 plugin generates a connection secret. This field shows you that identifier.

widget.label: Turn the OAuth2 feature ON or OFF for Users
widget.tooltip: Each user may be entitled to make us of an application. To allow your users to make use of that application, they will need to have their own identifier and secret codes. These are found in their account, but this checkmark has to be turned on for them to see and use the codes.
